snippet: A decade ago today, George W. Bush signed a memo on the "humane treatment" of Taliban and al Qaeda detainees.
abstract: A decade ago today, George W. Bush signed a memo on the "humane treatment" of Taliban and al Qaeda detainees.
lead_paragraph: An absorbing article by Andrew Cohen on the Atlantic's website has reminded me that today marks a very special 10th anniversary. Ten years ago policies were established that led to Abu Ghraib, the secret C.I.A. prisons, the Guantanamo Bay detention camp and torture; that led, in other words, to a period that ranks among the worst in American history for the abuse of executive power, the shredding of civil liberties and the undermining of the judicial system.  At the time, we didn't know it was happening, because it was done in secret.

headline.main: Ten Years Later: Torture, Indefinite Detention, Military Tribunals
